Поверните телефон горизонтально , чтобы начать

Технологии Деньги Достижения
Пройти квиз
Разработка: студия ЯР
1922
- undefined

Since the moment of savings offices establishment on December 26, 1922, for many years ahead the main calculation tool of a savings office was abacus. Depositors' current accounts have been recording in books and the customer was given a very important document – savings bank book.

1924
- undefined

Everyday use saw appeared money boxes sold by savings offices where besides their keys stayed for safekeeping. To calculate the coins, money boxes holder either came to the savings office or called its officer to his/her place. Money collected 
in money boxes were recorded in a savings 
bank book.

1927
- undefined

The structure of card index files began improving, current accounts recording was switched from books to card records that were often filled 
in using typing machines.

1929
- undefined

From the late 1920s, in savings offices abacus gradually was replaced by arithmometers. Felix was the most widespread arithmometer in USSR, it was named after Felix Dzerzhinsky. It had been being produced since 1929 to 1978 with total circulation of several million machines. Totally, more than two dozens of modifications were created. To make calculation, mechanical arithmometer's handle had to be turned 
according to certain rules.

1930
- undefined

One of the novelties became so-called united savings book – special form of a savings book through which it was possible to deposit and withdraw money at any savings bank within 
a certain territory.

1941
- 1945

On June 23, 1941, temporary restrictions were implemented to the return of prewar deposits (canceled in January 1944), at the same time, 
the calculation procedure was simplified – 
the deposits could be obtained upon presentation of a savings bank book. Field savings offices were arranged. They performed acceptance and return of deposits directly at the front lines.

- 1945
1947
- 1951

Due to the Monetary Reform, a network 
of savings bank branches was expanding, 
especially in rural area.

- 1951
1953
- undefined

Improved VK-1 arithmometer became available 
to the employees. There small levers were replaced by a keyboard with ten keys for inputting a number. Only due to the application of keyboard entry, the performance of VK-1 tripled 
in comparison with Felix.

1955
- undefined

Savings offices began crediting funds to accounts through cashless funds transfer.

1960
- undefined

During the 1960s, the fleet of calculating machines tripled including SVD-107 single meter calculating machines.

1963
- undefined

In 1963, employees of savings offices implemented in their work a new business process to accept payments. Actually, for the first time 
the attention was put to the development 
of cashless transfers. Over year, 
their amount increased by 20 %.

1970
- undefined

In 1970, the experiment was started to pay salaries through savings offices at the Belarusian Automobile Plant in Zhodino.

1975
- undefined

Savings offices were equipped with electromechanic adding machines “Ascota”. Using them, the employees made entries in operational journals, current accounts, savings bank books 
and orders, carried out record keeping of deposits by their types with accrual of interest.

1983
- 1984

Savings offices were equipped with first personal computers of domestic production: Iskra1030M, ЕС-1840, PTK SB-1.

- 1984
1992
- undefined

The first Local Area Network was created 
at the Savings Bank (LAN) for 30 working places.

1994
- undefined

Savings Bank branches started to provide integrated services for entities of different 
forms of ownership, firstly, small and medium enterprises. 

The banks introduced 
"Operation Bank Day" Software.

1996
- undefined

The Client-Bank system was introduced.

1997
- undefined

The bank installed a specialized equipment 
for work with products of Eurocard/Mastercard 
in real-time mode.

1998
- undefined

Interbranch Settlement Center (ISC) 
was commissioned for operation which allowed 
to manage payment flows, perform payments among the bank's customers according 
to the schedule "on a same day basis". 

The Government of the Republic of Belarus elected Belarusbank as an authorized body for implementing government programs of housing construction and development of agricultural sector. A new area of activity was the implementation of the national budget 
on incomes within the system of one bank  
and creation of a single mechanism for collecting and accounting payments into the budget.

1998
- undefined

In Belarusbank, the first ATM appeared in 1998. Now it is in the Museum of the History of Savings Business and is still working: it will easily accept 
a payment card and issue a souvenir ticket. 
It will not work to pay for anything and even view the balance, because it is not connected 
to the banking processing system.

2000
- undefined

The Bank became a principal member 
of VISA International.

2004
- undefined

Belarusbank issued 1,000,000 plastic bank cards.

2005
- undefined

Belarsubank issued the first in Belarus VISA EMV chip Card.

2008
- undefined

In August, the bank offered new M-Banking service. 

The Belarsubank cardholders got 
a remote access to their card account through Internet to make payments and obtain necessary information Online via new Internet-banking service.

2009
- undefined

In October, the Bank issued a new card product – BELKART-M and Visa Electron chip saving cards. 

By the end of the year, 70 % of the bank’s branch offices were connected to the centralized data warehouse on transactions of individuals, allowing to individuals to perform transactions on their deposit accounts in any region of the Republic regardless of the location of an account opening.

2010
- undefined

The Bank overcame the four millionth milestone for the plastic cards issue. As of January 1, 2010, 4.9 million cards were in circulation, in addition, the bank overcame two millionth milestone for BELKART national payment system cards.

2011
- undefined

In August, Belarsubank achieved the next in turn significant milestone in card business after having installed the thousandth ATM within the territory of Belarus. 

Belarsubank proved its leading position 
in the field of development of electronic payment system using plastic cards by installing the twenty-thousandth POS-terminal and two-thousandth infokiosk.

2012
- undefined

Belarusbank became the first country's bank 
to obtain a certificate for acquiring of contactless cards in the Republic of Belarus (Visa payWave).

2013
- undefined

In March, Belarusbank began to install terminal equipment to maintain Visa Electron contactless cards with payWave technology. 

In May, 
the number of users of Belarusbank remote banking services surpassed 1,000,000 persons.

2014
- undefined

Belarusbank presented new co-branded 
Belkart-Maestro card allowing to use it abroad, – 
new product on the market of payment bank cards of Belarus. 

Belarusbank payment cards of either payment system became discount cards in Evroopt trade network.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank was the first in Republic to provide the customers with the possibility to transfer money through phone number. New service became available for the Bank's card 
holders – MBanking service users.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank implemented common project in partnership with McDonald’s and MasterCard. Belarusbank installed corresponding terminal equipment for Masterсard PayPass contactless technology within the chain of restaurants.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank offered a new service for individuals – repayment of loans in cash through the bank's infokiosks using Cash-in function.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank installed the fifty-thousandth 
POS-terminal.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank in cooperation with Beltelecom Republican Unitary Enterprise and Assist Belarus Company of Electronic Payments implemented service for payment of connection to Internet network through Wi-Fi access points located 
in public places using bank cards.

2015
- undefined

Belarusbank equipped with POS-terminals more than 300 vehicles of Road Safety Units all across Belarus.

2015
- undefined

With participation of Belarusbank, McDonald’s Belarusian restaurant chain installed special infokiosks intended for ordering and payment 
of orders using bank payment cards.

2016
- undefined

Belarusbank installed the first Belarusian 
currency exchange terminal.

2016
- undefined

Belarusbank installed the first ATM for drivers.

2016
- undefined

Belarusbank was the first in CIS countries 
to launch a new innovative product – 
Internet-bonds.

2016
- undefined

The Bank launched "Denominator Calculator" mobile app.

2016
- undefined

Belarusbank in partnership with Belarusian Railway launched a new technology – purchase 
of electronic tickets for international traffic trains.

2017
- undefined

For visually impaired users Belarusbank installed an ATM in Gomel equipped with a special voice information reporting system.

2018
- undefined

Belarusbank introduced a mobile payment service Belarusbank Pay for its customers, allowing holders of Mastercard or Maestro payment cards to perform contactless payments using their smart phones.

2018
- undefined

In Dana Mall Shopping and Recreation Center Belarusbank opened the first self-service point 
in addition to standard self-service devices 
(ATM, infokiosk), the bank's first currency exchange terminal with function  
of paying in coins is located here. It allows customers to exchange dollars, euros, 
Russian rubles for Belarusian rubles using cash.

2018
- undefined

The Bank started providing the remote customer support for the Client-Bank (WEB) users.

2018
- undefined

Virtual consultant Zlata appeared on the Bank's corporate web-site.

2019
- undefined

Android system based Smart phones users 
got the possibility to open Internet-deposits 
in MBanking mobile application.

2019
- undefined

Belarusbank Depository was the first 
in the country to provide the possibility 
of remote customer servicing.

2019
- undefined

The Bank became an acquirer bank in the project of the Sosedi trade network to launch selfcheckouts.

2019
- undefined

Belarusbank Mastercard and Visa card holders 
got access to the Apple Pay service.

2019
- undefined

Belarusbank in partnership with Assist Company provided the opportunity to pay Online for train 
trips using the "Belarusian Railway. My train" mobile application.

2019
- undefined

The Bank started providing services 
for cards of Mir payment system.

2020
- undefined

The Bank began to issue BELKART cards 
with EMV microprocessor.

2020
- undefined

Belarsubank and Cashew fintech startup launched an innovative payment method using QR code.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank Visa and Mastercard card holders 
got access to the Garmin Pay payment service allowing to make purchases using Garmin watches without using a payment card or mobile phone.

2020
- undefined

Samsung Pay became available from 
the above-mentioned year for Belarusbank Visa, Maestro and Maestro co-branded card holders.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank launched the project for payment 
of trips by Minsk public transports using smart phone – TIX service.

2020
- undefined

The Bank presented new money transfer "Khutki" allowing to receive cash from ATMs without card.

2020
- undefined

The Bank implemented a service for cash withdrawals at merchants by card holders.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank presented an innovative project "Look and pass". Unique service allows to pay 
the trip by metro using technology of face recognition.

2020
- undefined

Belarusbank Maestro cards and Maestro 
co-branded card holders were the first 
to access to the "Koshelek Pay" service.

2020
- undefined

Belarsubank Visa, Mastercard, Maestro 
and co-branded Maestro card holders can add their payment cards to the Fitbit Pay payment service. It allows to make purchases using Fitbit smartwatches or fitness-trackers without using payment card or phone.

2020
- undefined

Belarsubank Mastercard card holders were one 
of the first in the country to get the opportunity to pay for purchases using Mi Smart Band 4 NFC fitness tracker.

2020
- undefined

The first legal cryptocurrency exchange service was launched in Belarus: since November 2020, Belarusbank has offered the opportunity to Visa card holders to replenish e-wallets for further cryptocurrency purchase and sale.

2021
- undefined

Belarusbank Visa card holders got access 
to Koshelek Pay payment service.

2021
- undefined

Belarusbank became a partner of new BYNEX Exchange designed for dealing with Bitcoin 
and Ethereum cryptocurrencies. As a result 
of the cooperation between the bank 
and ERPBEL Company, which has developed exchange platform, players can replenish their accounts and withdraw currency (Belarusian rubles and US dollars) with the lowest fee using Visa payment card.

2021
- undefined

For merchants, Belarusbank implemented 
the connection to the Bank's acquiring network 
of programmed checkout – innovative device combining POS-terminal functionality, 
cash register and tax authorities instrument 
of control or operator's instrument of control.

2021
- undefined

Belarusbank, Mastercard and Assist Company were first in the country to implement a new service for payments security: MDES for Merchants (М4М) tokenization technology became available to users.

2021
- undefined

Belarusbank in partnership with Assist electronic payments provider implemented Visa Token Service (VTS) technology of Visa Global Payment Technologies Company.
